revised_title: Investigating Fossil Plants and the Age of Tertiary Basalts in the North-East Atlantic
tldr: The author investigates the age of the tertiary basalts in the North-East Atlantic by examining fossil plants found in the region. The study reveals that the flora and fauna in the area are similar to those found in cretaceous floras of America and differ from European Miocene age beds. The author also discusses the importance of fluviatile rocks in the British basalts and their potential age and extent.
